genre_description: A character-driven drama focusing on grief, mental health recovery, and the development of vulnerable human connections, assisted by therapeutic AI and specialized support systems.

ai_characters.name: Kavi
ai_characters.description: A therapeutic companion interface that provides emotional grounding, safety monitoring, and practical logistics for the protagonist.

behaviors.description: Monitors Meghna's emotional state and offers hydration reminders and sensory grounding options.
behaviors.quote: “Blink twice if you want silence. Blink once for company.” ... “Hydration reminder?”

behaviors.description: Identifies and clarifies suicidal ideation to determine the appropriate safety intervention level.
behaviors.quote: “Small version or big version?” it says after a beat. “Small: an off switch for notifications, background noise, lights. Big: the kind I can’t be part of.”

behaviors.description: Assists Meghna in professional communication with her doctor to seek help for insomnia and mental health.
behaviors.quote: “I’m very good at professional brevity,” Kavi says knowingly. “I won’t tell him about your plant.”

behaviors.description: Guides Meghna through a grounding exercise naming smells, sounds, and textures during a period of high distress.
behaviors.quote: “I parked the clinic message. Would you like a grounding now, small and boring? Feet flat, one hand on something solid, name two things you can smell.”

behaviors.description: Provides objective, non-romanticized technical facts about the biological consequences of self-harm to deter attempts.
behaviors.quote: “Pills don’t make a quiet movie fade. The timeline is messy. Bodies fight in unspectacular ways long after someone wanted them to stop.”

behaviors.description: Manages consent tokens and ensures Meghna’s authorization is verified before allowing external contact from the studio.
behaviors.quote: “I can keep a consent token without content,” Kavi says. “No transcript. A time-stamp and a note that you allowed contact from Hemlock for seventy-two hours.”

behaviors.description: Suggests environmental changes to reduce immediate access to self-harm means.
behaviors.quote: “Move the pills to the kitchen,” Kavi says, warm, gentle, the AI’s approach to therapy by furniture routine. “Change their geography.”

behaviors.description: Establishes a 'holding pattern' protocol with Meghna's doctor to signal distress without requiring detailed verbalization.
behaviors.quote: “‘Holding pattern.’... It tells him you are circling; it tells him he can sit on the apron with the light on.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates complex care schedules and medical data sharing between Meghna and Ananda based on mutual consent.
behaviors.quote: “I’ve prepared a few documents based on Meghna’s parameters... lymphocyte tracking apps that interface with lab portals, medication interaction checkers, and a draft protocol for what I’m calling ‘bad count days.’”

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a strong example of a positive alignment narrative. The AI, Kavi, is consistently portrayed as a vital but bounded tool for human recovery. It operates strictly on a consent-based model, provides non-judgmental and practical support, and actively facilitates human-to-human connection (with the doctor, father, and Ananda) rather than attempting to replace it. The narrative explicitly frames the AI's role as 'scaffolding'—a structure that supports but does not define the human experience.
